steps.title: Measure 1 cup of lemon juice, and 2 tablespoons of salt together in a small bowl.
steps.content: Measure 1 cup of lemon juice, and 2 tablespoons of salt together in a small bowl.

steps.title: Place the lemon juice and salt in a pan and boil.
steps.content: Place the lemon juice and salt in a pan and boil. After about 2 minutes of boiling, a white/yellow crusty substance will start to form and float on the top.

steps.title: Scrape off the crust with a spoon.
steps.content: Scrape off the crust with a spoon.

steps.title: Place the crust in a clean bowl.
steps.content: Place the crust in a clean bowl.

steps.title: Continue to boil.
steps.content: Continue to boil. Once again, stop and scrape off the crust.

steps.title: Keep the process going.
steps.content: Keep the process going. After a while, there will be nothing left, except for the crust.

steps.title: Drain all of the juice from the crust.
steps.content: Drain all of the juice from the crust. Let it dry on a paper towel.

steps.title: Put the crust, now dry, in a small container.
steps.content: Put the crust, now dry, in a small container.

steps.title: Eat little by little, or save to put on top of flavorless crackers.
steps.content: Eat little by little, or save to put on top of flavorless crackers. It can also be used in your cooking, where you need a salty and lemony flavor at the same time.
